input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Gender has a direct effect on smoking and lung cancer. Smoking has a direct effect on tar deposit. Tar deposit has a direct effect on lung cancer. Gender is unobserved. We know that female causes smoking. smoking causes high tar deposit. female or high tar deposit causes lung cancer. We observed the person is non-female. Would the person has lung cancer if nonsmoking instead of smoking?
